tweets.text:
Wild fish and their waters need your help. We have launched a Parliamentary Petition to give @EnvAgency the funds and freedom they need to protect English rivers. Please sign and share our petition to give rivers a fighting chance. #standingupforrivers
https://t.co/oxNkHEqHQL https://t.co/0sZJF68qs8

The river restoration schemes we delivered in autumn last year are looking lovely now they are vegetating up a bit üå± lovely video to show the progress @Trent_R_Trust @EnvAgencyMids https://t.co/No6ouHwchh
This is the CSO running into our Bathing Status designated site today yuk @YorkshireWater @EnvAgency https://t.co/iCMkycnKiy

This is part of the reason the wharfe is a shadow of its former self. Yet the @EnvAgency claim it is ecologically good in fact too good to be true. Just more spin on a river slowly dying. https://t.co/gmR5OV2Acw

Floating pennywort is an invasive plant & costs the economy at least ¬£25m per annum 

We've teamed up with @AnglingTrust @BritishCanoeing, and local volunteers to leave floating pennywort with nowhere to hide. 

More info https://t.co/1yrWDiUnxY
#INNSweek @InvasiveSp https://t.co/SEVYnpx6W0

urls.title: Managing floating pennywort ‚Äì how you can help - GB non-native species secretariat
urls.description: Floating pennywort is a highly invasive aquatic plant that was first introduced to Britain as an ornamental pond plant in the 1990‚Äô s. In the wild, this species can grow up to 20cm a day and rapidly forms dense floating mats of weed across waterbodies. These crowd out native species, block light impacting on the aquatic ecosystem, interfere with activities such as angling, paddling and sailing, and potentially increase the flood risk. Unless effective management is undertaken it is likely that this

Going #Fishing? Remember, it‚Äôs close season for coarse fishing on rivers. This means it's illegal to fish for course fish in rivers until 15th June inclusive.

If you spot incidents of illegal fishing, you can report this to the Environment Agency‚Äôs incident number 0800 80 70 60. https://t.co/Pmp3PCZ7qb

tweets.text:
Unfortunately I don't think #WalleysQuarry will be shut down. I suspect pressure from central government is being applied to keep it open. That would explain why @EnvAgencyMids have completely abandoned their role as regulator and taken on the role of facilitator.

#StopTheStink

Currently growing barley but it‚Äôs future = concrete. And a massive SuDS area to mitigate against flooding. Because this is a river valley. It handily holds excess water for us for free. Utter madness to build here!! @CPREKent @CommunityPlann1 @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency https://t.co/owzHqgEN8G

The @EnvAgency appear to be stalling until Sept now. Why is this not being treated as a Public Health emergency @ClareDinnisEA ? Are you really saying it‚Äôs ok not to be able to breathe properly or experience nose bleeds for the next 4 months?! #stopsthestink @MattHancock https://t.co/YfZPkd3lOO
